title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 57-1.4 - Responsibilities of providers

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 57-1.4 - Responsibilities of providers

State Regulations
(a) Pursuant to the requirements of sections
1132
(3), 3003
(4), 3004, 3007, 5003, and
6507
(3)(a)
of the Education Law, a provider, at a
minimum, shall offer the syllabus prepared by the department. However, nothing
in this section shall preclude providers from offering additional coursework or
training which exceeds, or expands upon, the two hour syllabus prescribed by
the department. (b) A provider
shall execute a certification of completion, in triplicate on forms provided by
the department, for each person completing the coursework or
training. (c) Within 10 calendar
days of the completion of said coursework or training, the provider shall
submit two copies of the certification of completion to the person completing
the coursework or training. (d) The
provider must retain a copy of the certification of completion in the
provider's files for not less than five years from the date of completion of a
course. Notes
